Free Face Masks for the Harrisburg South Dakota Community.

The Harrisburg Community Foundation, in cooperation with the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services and the South Dakota Department of Health are making available over 10,000 free reusable/washable masks for the Harrisburg South Dakota Community.

The face coverings come in packs of 5, are 100% cotton and can be machine washed in warm water up to 15 times before discarding.

You can pick up your free face coverings at the Harrisburg High School and Harrisburg North Middle School during normal business hours — Monday through Friday, 8:00 am - 3:00 pm starting Today through Wednesday, August 19, 2020.

The masks are available for everyone in the Harrisburg SD Community area, you do not need to be a student to receive the free face covering. More information about the face coverings can be found here: https://harrisburgcf.org/face-coverings

Thank you to the Harrisburg School District Staff for their help with the distribution!

Harrisburg Community Foundation is feeling excited in Harrisburg, South Dakota.
August 4, 2019 at 7:35 PM · Harrisburg, SD ·

The Harrisburg Community Foundation (HCF) is excited to announce the opening of the application period for its Fall 2019 Community Grant.

Grantmaking is one way the Harrisburg Community Foundation (HCF) makes a difference in our community. HCF provides several funding opportunities that support organizations and individuals (through organizations) that work to enhance the quality of life in the Harrisburg, South Dakota area.
